radiographic_examinations.findings: Hyperpigmented and hypopigmented areas, no bone spicule pigmentation of the retina.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No definite CNV lesion identified; staining observed.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A small subfoveal hemorrhage in the right eye.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity dropped from 20/60 to 20/80 in 24 hours; no definite CNV lesion found.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No anatomic cause for sudden decrease in acuity.
Increased atrophy and scarring consistent with an involuted choroidal neovascular membrane lesion.
Subretinal changes consistent with fibrosis and cystoid edema in the right eye.
Central scotoma visible in the right eye.
